Syntax Tree API¶

struct Tree¶

Syntax tree structure

Equiv to :

This->first_child————->Another tree…

|
next————->Another tree…
|

|—->next (last_child)

void init_nb_state(int nbStates)¶

First function to be called Init the states of the interpretor with 0

Parameters

  • nbStates – set the len of the list used by the interpretor

STree *new_stree(char from_loop, FILE *in, Buffer *buffer, char INTERACTIVE, char *prgm_should_stop)¶

Create the syntax tree. You can also uses it yourself if you define your own “readChar” function.

Parameters

  • from_loop – 0 if call from the beginning, 1 if call recursively from a loop

  • in – Input file on which you want to read the program

  • buffer – Buffer where you want to store the read program

  • INTERACTIVE – Are you in interactive mode, or not ?

  • prgm_should_stop – Value of this pointer is updated by a call to this function. If set to 1, you reached EOF and you should stop evaluating the file you are reading.

Returns

The newly created STree, or NULL

void stree_eval(STree *s, FILE *out)¶

Evaluate the syntax tree

Parameters

  • s – Syntax tree to be evaluated

  • out – Where the program output have to be printed
